results.title: The Origin of modern astronomy
results.creator_credit: Coastal Community Colleges and David P. Stone
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
The Greeks considered the Earth to be the centre of the universe. Ptolemy’s model of the universe lasted until Copernicus began to postulate that it was the Earth which moved around the sun. Due to his allegiance to the Church, Copernicus did not pursue his theories, but Galileo, was able, with the invention of the telescope, to support the Copernican model of the universe. His ideas were considered heretical by the Counter-Reformation Church, however they sowed the seeds for future observation and theories. The work of Kepler followed, and it is this work, supporting Copernicus and Galileo which bridged the gap between ancient and modern astronomy.

results.title: The Organisers
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Roger Owen and Anthony Cash
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Teaching Adults”.
How far do organisers think in educational terms? Have they a philosophy of adult education? Do they know the environment they serve? Are they concerned with the actual quality of the teaching that goes on in their area or college.

results.title: The Organ. Part 1
results.creator_credit: World Mirror-Realist Films, Ken Cameron and Muir Mathieson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Simon Preston, speaking from the console of the great Harrison organ in Westminster Abbey, tells of the history and construction of the instrument. He explains the simple theory of sound generation, the problems of providing constant air pressure, and the complexities of playing. Works by Mozart, Purcell and others are played.

results.title: The Orchestra
results.creator_credit: World Mirror-Realist Films, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids, Ken Cameron and Muir Mathieson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
The formation, selection and training of the National Youth Orchestra of Great Britain. Spotlights each section of the orchestra as they rehearse subtleties of intonation and phrasing until something like perfection is achieved. Then they perform Dvorak’s Carnival Overture.

results.title: The Orange grower
results.brief_description: The story of an orange-grower and his family in the citrus fruit growing area of USA and how they raise and harvest their crop. Budding, pruning, planting, fertilising, irrigating, controlling weeds and pests, and combating extremes of temperature, are shown in detail.
results.description: The story of an orange-grower and his family in the citrus fruit growing area of USA and how they raise and harvest their crop. Budding, pruning, planting, fertilising, irrigating, controlling weeds and pests, and combating extremes of temperature, are shown in detail.

results.title: The Opposite of sex
results.creator_credit: Rysher Entertainment, David Kirkpatrick, Michael Besman and Don Roos
results.brief_description: Christina Ricci stars as 16 year old Dedee Truitt, a teenage Lolita with a caustic tongue and scrupulous libido. ‘The Opposite of Sex’ opens with Dedee running away from her white trash mother to go and stay with her well to do gay half brother Bill (Martin Donovan), and his hunky not too bright boyfriend, Randy (William Lee Scott). Soon enough the malicious vamp has turned everyones life upside down, taking off with her brothers boyfriend and his dead ex-lovers ashes. Writer and director Don Roos has fashioned a sharp witty film which inventively uses Dedee’s voice over narration to plead her case to the audience and to confound our expectations of what she might possibly be thinking next. Ricci is wonderfully droll and jaded in the title role but not to be undone is Lisa Kudrow as the bitter and suspicious sister of Bill’s dead lover. Cast also includes Lyle Lovett, Ivan Sergei, Johnny Galecki

results.title: The Opportunity class
results.creator_credit: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Dept. of Film and Television and Richard Jones
results.brief_description: A nursery class where handicapped and normal children mix in equal numbers, and where a support program for mothers of the handicapped is arranged. The progress of the children is followed from the nursery to later stages of their education. The attitudes of parents, nursery staff and the children’s later teachers are also explored.

results.title: The Opening: National Gallery of Victoria
results.brief_description: An ABC-TV Outside broadcast introduced by Peter Couchman. The National Gallery of Victoria’s new building, the dream of the Director of the Gallery, Mr. Eric Westbrook, for twelve years came to fruition after four years of planning. The architect, Roy Grounds’ “Vision Splendid” has become a reality and Stage 1 of Victoria’a new art and cultural centre is opened. An on-the-spot film of the opening ceremony in the Great Hall and speech by the Rt. Hon. Sir Henry Bolte. Fanfare composed by George Dreyfus.

results.title: The Opening of the Baden Powell Hut at Brittania Creek, near Warburton, Victoria, October 1954
results.brief_description: Shows Baden Powell Hut opening near Warburton; Brownie Cottage; and a march past in the rain. Of historical value. No credits available.
